summary.p: Bullinger recommends Theodor [Bibliander], who will report [from Zurich]. - If Blarer knows anything about the outcome of the Imperial Diet [at Worms] or about Luther, he should share this information.

div.p: G[reetings] I [say]. Since I have nothing to write, most beloved man, I desire this one thing to be obtained from you alone, that you kindly receive and hold in commendation our most esteemed teacher and brother Theodor [Bibliander].
You will hear all our affairs from him.
If you have any certain information about the outcome of the Imperial Diet and Mr. Luther, please let me know. Farewell. Zurich, August 10, 1545.
To the most distinguished man Mr. Ambrosius Blarer, his most esteemed lord. Constance.
